sense.name: evaluation
sense.commentary: APPRAISAL[+event] The act of assessing the value or the worth of something.
sense.examples: He looked my car up and down, giving it his appraisal. I'm scheduled for an appraisal on Tuesday. The antique experts had a harsh appraisal of the value of my lunchbox collection. I contacted a real estate appraisal institute when I wanted to sell my house. John was looking for an honest appraisal of his skills.

sense.name: physical document
sense.commentary: The pieces of paper that show the results of an evaluation.
sense.examples: At the end of the inspection, the car dealer handed me the appraisal. I stuck the appraisal in my pocket and walked out.
